intro: Lomariopsis sorbifolia var. resectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomariopsis, is a rare and specialized fern native to specific regions of New Zealand. It is characterized by its finely divided, narrow leaves that form a dense, compact rosette, which helps it retain moisture in its often humid and shaded habitat. The plant belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is typically found in coastal or subalpine environments.
